content: ⚠️ Modified Contribution : Added a 6th test case to test for large X's (to check for bad code that times out if the number of times to subtract by 1 is too big).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle that requires some thinking.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle. After a little moment of thinking I realize that I can divide N only if N is even, because if you get fraction number you cannot get to 1.

It is nice in a way that the description does provide an algorithm with solution.

I think the "divide" operation can be described better? Since the rest of the statement only mentions "divide N by 2", I first understood the entire operation as "return math.ceil (N/2)", but it seems to be something like "if (N%2==0) {return N/2;} else{ return N-1;}" instead.
Perhaps labeling the two operation as "Operation A" and "Operation B", and then stating "However, you only can execute 'operation A' a maximum of A times" will result in a clearer statement.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Creative take on collatz conjecture.
